subtitles_text: >> JEFF: Previously on Survivor:
Michael was determined to make a kill.
>> MICHAEL: This is the pig- killer.
>> JEFF V.: His stupid spear. "I'm going to go catch pigs.
Go get me a pig." >> JEFF: At Ogakor, Jerri and
Colby whispered sweet nothings to each other
>> COLBY: Black coffee, or cream and sugar?
>> JERRI: Cream and sugar. I'm such a sucker for cowboys.
>> JEFF: In the toughest challenge yet, Kucha won
immunity... ( cheering )
...sending Ogakor to Tribal Council, where lines were drawn
when Jerri made it clear who her friends were.
>> JERRI: I've been very fortunate in my ability to bond
with Amber, Mitchell and Colby. >> JEFF: But there was no bond
with Maralyn, who was voted out of the tribe.
It's time for you to go. 13 remain.
Tonight, one more will go. >> TINA: I had slept outside
last night, as did Keith. We were the first ones up, so we
thought the first ones up, let's just get up and go fishing this
morning. So we cleared everything off the
boat, got the fishing rods together.
Jerri popped up out of the tent, ran, turned over the canoe...
and acted like she was going to get ready to go fishing.
>> MITCHELL: You guys wanna go? ( canister rattling )
You're going to take this? >> KEITH: Yeah.
Jerri and the others, they wanted to take the canoe out.
You know, we said, "Well, we're just getting ourselves ready,
we've got all our gear, we're getting ready to go."
"Oh, we were going to do that." Well, isn't that ironic, you
know, just 'cause we were going to go?
>> TINA: Well, that's why we were going to go, because you
guys were sleeping, so... ( Jerri groans )
I just said "Look, you know, we were gonna go fishing.
You all were asleep. We're going to go fishing."
And apparently, Keith wanted to have a talk with me, so he said,
"Well, Tina, let's just go walk along the bank and fish that
way." >> KEITH: At Tribal Council last
night, Tina and I had an opportunity to get a little bit
better understanding of where we sit within our own tribe.
When Jerri was asked the question who her friends are,
she made a point of mentioning Amber, Colby, Mitchell and
herself, that they all get along best.
And then, of course, she wanted to make sure that everybody was
clear that she was here to win the money.
And she's going to do whatever she has to to win the money.
So, Tina and I were a little miffed by that.
>> TINA: You have four or five young people playing.
You know, they've got so much chemistry that it is almost
second nature just to-- whoo-- just immediately gravitate
towards one another. And it makes me feel kind of
like an outsider, which I am an outsider at this point.
>> JERRI: It's all I can do to keep from just laughing out
loud. At Tribal Council, Jeff asked me
who I felt I had built friendships with.
And immediately after I said it, I kind of sucked it back up,
because I realized I was basically challenging people to
vote for me. Which doesn't put me in a very
good position. >> KEITH: Jerri is perfect for
this game. She will ride the team until
it's time to take the knife out and cut someone's throat.
>> JERRI: That was good stuff. >> KEITH: I didn't come out here
to be pushed around by a bartender-wannabe-actress.
Maybe it's time just to shake her world up a little bit.
I can tell you one thing: Tina and I are not going to go down
without a fight. I came here to win the money,
but now my motive isn't to win the money, but to do everything
I can to make sure she does not win the money.
>> ALICIA: Wow, what is it? >> RODGER: I have no idea.
>> ALICIA: You guys are not going to believe this one.
>> KIMMI: What? >> RODGER: We got a chicken egg.
>> ALICIA: We have a real egg. >> RODGER: "For a change of the
menu, you must work with great haste.
Build a pen on your beach, and slide the pieces in place."
This morning, we received tree mail.
And I went out there to it, and it was a bird's nest.
And it involves a challenge of building a chicken coop.
>> ALICIA: Grab one end. ( indistinct voices )
>> KIMMI: Okay, all of these are pretty much straight.
I definitely have to appear that I'm into this challenge, because
my head was on the chopping block-- I know, with a couple of
people-- because of, um... you know, my almost not eating the
worm and the cow brain thing. At least this chicken coop thing
is a little bit of a change of pace.
I know it might seem ironic, because I don't eat mammals.
You know, I haven't had poultry in over ten years, and I haven't
had red meat in over 15 years, but if it boosts up morale for
these guys, it's going to be good.
>> NICK: Oh, yeah. >> MICHAEL: See, what I can do
is I can pry this over with my pry bar here...
>> JEFF V.: I want those chickens so bad.
For one reason, so Mike will quit fishing and walking around
here flexing his muscle. I really want chicken.
And I'm not above snatching it out of the other team's arms.
I want a chicken. >> JEFF: Okay, today's challenge
is a reward challenge. And the map to your reward is
scrambled in a puzzle. The first tribe to completely
unscramble their puzzle gets three egg-laying chickens and
one rooster. Big reward, a lot of eggs.
Pick your spots, and we'll get started.
Playing for three egg-laying chickens and a rooster.
Survivors ready? Go!
>> Back it up, back it up, back it up.
>> MITCHELL: Go around, rotate, rotate...
>> AMBER: Bring this one up and we'll bring this one down, over
here. >> COLBY: Right here.
>> KEITH: No... slide it over... >> JERRI: That one, that one
down. >> RODGER: You got it made.
>> KIMMI: Okay, well, we have this whole side, so now we can
work this... we got to do this piece...
>> NICK: Yeah, swing this one like this.
Goes... no, leave that. >> RODGER: Doesn't that blue
piece right there go with...? >> NICK: It goes in the middle.
>> RODGER: It goes in the middle, that's right.
>> KIMMI: Those two need to be together.
That should be one, two, three. >> COLBY: No, no, no, no.
( indistinct voices ) >> ALICIA: That one he's got his
hand on. >> KIMMI: Okay, hold on, hang
on, hang on. >> ALICIA: Get off of this
table. >> MICHAEL: Get off, Kimmi.
>> KIMMI: Well, what...? ( indistinct voices )
>> JEFF V.: What goes with it? >> ALICIA: This one goes with
it. >> JEFF V.: There goes the top
corner. >> KEITH: Wait a minute, look,
look, look, look, look. This goes here, and we're done.
>> AMBER: I say... just start doing stuff.
>> KIMMI: That piece goes right here.
>> JEFF V.: You had it right. >> KIMMI: No, that was right.
That one goes over... >> JEFF V.: You had it right.
>> KIMMI: That-that goes down. This goes over.
( indistinct voices ) ( all cheering )
>> JEFF: Good job. ( all cheering )
( indistinct voices ) >> JEFF: This is your map to
your reward. Got to figure out where you're
at, where you need to go. >> NICK: No, wait, think about
perspective. This is our blue, and that's
their green. >> ALICIA: Yeah, "X" marks the
spot. >> ELISABETH: You guys, we're
going straight. >> ALICIA: There they are.
( whooping ) Hello, my lovelies.
( clucking ) ( Elisabeth squawks )
>> JEFF V.: We got chickens. >> ALICIA: Henrietta, Polly,
Ruby and Rocky. >> JEFF V.: Hey, Henrietta, hey,
Ruby. >> ALICIA: We all have to decide
who's going to kill one. >> ELISABETH: I can't believe
I'm holding a chicken. >> RODGER: Just don't hesitate
about putting him in. Get him down in there.
>> KIMMI: Don't break her wings, though.
>> RODGER: Who's next? >> ALICIA: You're gonna squeeze
four chickens in there? >> KIMMI: It's wrong.
>> NICK: They're giving you eggs and protein and vitamins and all
that good stuff, okay? >> KIMMI: Can't they give us
some edamame, some tofu? >> ELISABETH: It's a good thing,
you guys. You guys, we just won a reward.
It's like, everyone just smile for a second-- whoo, reward!
>> MICHAEL: I felt when we won the chickens, "Oh, no, I'm
unnecessary for food now." They could eat a chicken every
other day and be totally fine, until the merger.
And I thought to myself, "Consume those chickens as
quickly as possible so we're back to being hungry again."
( clucking ) >> RODGER: Shh...
>> NICK: We woke up in the morning, Rodger and I, relocated
the chicken coop, got them comfortable.
And then all of a sudden I see Mike preparing to kill the
rooster. Everybody else is sleeping, and
I said, "Let's wake up, figure out what our day schedule is a
little bit more before we kill it because if we had killed that
rooster, a lot of people would have been upset.
We have to make decisions as a group for us to get along.
...we should decide as a group when we're going to eat it.
>> RODGER: That's-that's what I asked him...
>> MICHAEL: That's what I just asked you.
>> NICK: We don't need one today.
( rooster crowing ) >> ELISABETH: That one's going
first. >> AMBER: There's a fire.
You can actually hear the trees falling down and burning.
>> TINA: You can hear it. I'll put on my tennis shoes.
It seems to be getting closer and closer.
You can see ash blowing in the wind.
We have no idea how close it is to our camp, even though we know
that it has to cross the water in order to get to us.
>> AMBER: It's a concern, um... But you know, I think we'll be
safe, as long as we head for the water and everybody does the
right thing. >> TINA: And you don't realize
that you're nothing to Jerri? She said, "I'm in it to win,"
and you know, she's going to do whatever it takes to win.
>> MITCHELL: Yeah. >> TINA: She sees that we've got
the fishing poles out, jumps out, grabs the boat, turns it
over. And it's like she has to have
her way. >> COLBY: Yeah.
>> TINA: And I am so over it, I just can't hardly stand it.
I mentioned my frustration with Jerri because it's building.
I don't know if it's just me. Do other people feel the same
way I feel? >> COLBY: It's going to get a
lot worse before it gets better. >> TINA: I'm sorry.
She's the most bossy, domineering person I've ever
met. >> COLBY: She's coming, by the
way. >> MITCHELL: Mm-hmm.
( sighs ) >> TINA: It was a little bit of
it just wanting to see how strong does Mitch and Colby
align with Jerri. And my thought was, if I could
get Colby, that would be two of us.
And then maybe Colby could talk to Amber, and that would be the
only chance that I would have to make it.
At this point, I don't have anything to lose.
>> COLBY: I had to get out of the tent.
There's a little estrogen overload in the tent right now,
and I just couldn't deal with that.
Tina was taking things way too personally.
>> KEITH: What happened last night at Tribal Council is what
really set Tina and I apart. Jeff said, "Well, who are your
friends?" and Jerri named, you know, four individuals.
>> COLBY: Right. >> KEITH: And Tina and I are
sitting on the sideline. So that was, you know...
Tina and I just figured, "Well, it's just a matter of time now."
>> COLBY: The powers that be have predetermined long ago the
pecking order here, and also the elimination order.
And, uh, Keith is up. Keith and I have spent a lot of
time together. Part of my reason for doing it--
one, we get along. Two, we need Keith right now, so
the last thing I'm going to do is alienate him.
>> KEITH: I'm cohabiting with people who... what do I do with
these people? >> COLBY: Yep.
>> KEITH: Who knows, man? You and Jerri could get married.
>> COLBY: I know that ain't happening.
>> KEITH: Tell you straight on right now, she ain't good enough
for you. And you know, it's cool you guys
got your little thing going, but I'm gonna tell you right now,
she ain't no way good enough for you.
>> COLBY ( laughs ): That's funny.
>> KEITH: I would beat you like a dog if I found out you two
hooked up. >> COLBY ( laughs ): Well,
thanks, bro. >> KEITH: That girl would cut
your throat in a heartbeat. >> COLBY: Yeah, you're right.
( Rocky crowing ) >> RODGER: Everybody's on the
same wavelength-- we want to have chicken today.
>> MICHAEL: I got a confirmation from Nick and Jeff, and
Elisabeth said yes. And if us four are saying yes,
everybody says yes. >> KIMMI: I say no. Okay.
( sputtering laughter ) I guess that doesn't work.
>> ALICIA: Nope. I say do it whenever you want to do it.
Just let me know when. >> KIMMI: Yeah, 'cause I want to
know... >> RODGER: Well, we've got to
get the water going. I would love to have fried
chicken tonight. It would be the first meal where
we didn't have to pass a piece of fish around six or seven
times and everybody take a bite of it.
Everybody would have their own piece of chicken.
>> MICHAEL: Oh, it's boiling. >> RODGER: Boiling?
>> MICHAEL: Boiling. Rodger...
Do we need anything besides tools?
>> RODGER: Just a hatchet and a block of wood.
>> KIMMI: Alicia, I'm leaving. >> ALICIA: Bye, sweetie.
I know it's harder for her. >> RODGER: Just gotta look at
it, it's no different than eating them fish we've been
eating. I'm gonna hold his wings.
Just-just make it a good... one good, clean blow.
( gentle crunching ) >> ALICIA: Mm, mm, mm!
>> MICHAEL: Everybody was loving the chickens.
This could be the end of the game for me, because they no
longer need me for a food source.
It ups the stakes definitely for me to catch the food.
But to stay in the limelight is going to be harder and harder
because you've got to keep one- upping yourself.
I caught one fish, and then I caught a bigger one, then I
caught three fish, then I caught five fish.
What am I going to do now, wrestle an alligator?
( laughs ) >> JEFF V.: I'll take a chicken
over fish any day. >> NICK: Once you go dark meat,
you don't ever go back. ( laughing )
( bird cawing ) >> MITCHELL: I'm just weak.
I'm hungry, I'm tired, physically, emotionally, I'm
gone. I feel that I think the most
about strategies, 'cause first of all, I don't have much else
to think about. And second of all, I want to go
far with this. After seeing Colby and Keith
talking over in the water for a couple of hours, who knows what
he's trying to convince Colby, but you know what?
Maybe he's just kind of taking Keith for a ride.
Colby had been talking a lot to Keith.
We know Keith is trying to rear something up from behind to try
to take one of us out. >> JERRI: The only way it would
work is if Keith convinced Tina and Colby...
>> AMBER: And Colby. >> JERRI: ...to vote against me.
>> AMBER: Right, then... >> JERRI: And you and us three
voted against Keith. It would be three and three.
>> AMBER: A tie. >> JERRI: And then you and me
with the most votes, I'd be gone.
>> AMBER: Yep. >> JERRI: This is definitely the
first time I've felt a little bit threatened.
And I guess I deserve it after making that pompous remark at
Tribal Council. >> AMBER: Colby could be talked
into things easily. >> JERRI: Yeah, that's what I'm
thinking, too. >> AMBER: He's not real strong
in his opinion. He-he sways a lot between what
people tell him. >> JERRI: Colby does seem to be
the one we're focused on in trying to ensure he's not
changing his mind. Ah...
There he is. Did you find a good spear?
>> COLBY: Yeah, I made a couple. >> JERRI: Yeah?
Cool. Colby was pretty excited about
going out hunting for a pig. And I think it's a brilliant
idea, especially with the fires right now, 'cause a lot of
wildlife has been flushed this way.
Fire pretty much stopped. It's always a possibility that
it could jump the river and come over here.
I think it's highly unlikely because there's no wind,
nothing. >> COLBY: See where all the
ground's burning right there? >> JERRI: Yeah.
>> COLBY: The fire was right there. See? It was right there.
>> JERRI: Oh! >> COLBY: We'll walk back.
We'd love to have a hog around here.
They're here. We've just got to find them, and I'm not
having a whole lot of luck. But I'm bound and determined to
put pork on the plate before I leave this place.
I mean, they're not going to live on the water, I don't
think. They're going to burrow back
aways, and I mean, I don't have a whole lot of experience with
hogs. >> JERRI: I think Colby is
definitely separating the game from any relationship with me.
I think it takes a strong person to do that, quite honestly,
especially when there's obviously, you know, some
attraction between us. >> JERRI: Where to, cowboy?
>> COLBY: I don't know. We'll head this way.
Who knows where the heck we're going.
Jerri's scared. She's worried that Keith and
Tina and I are going to join together and mastermind a back
door move to get rid of her. I don't want you to lose an
ounce of sleep worrying about what Tina's thinking or doing or
anything like that. >> JERRI: I'm not losing any
sleep. I'm just... I just know that
she's thinking ahead. I just want to beat her to the
draw, that's all. >> COLBY: I'm not saying I'm
holding out on making a deal with you to see how this thing
plays out. I'm saying there's no sense in
even making a deal, 'cause if we go into the merge undermanned,
it's all for naught, you know? >> JERRI: Don't worry about it.
You know, it's not like you're making a deal with the devil
here. I'm a little leery of Colby, and
I can tell actually that he's sort of distancing himself from
me a lot more. And I like hanging out with you,
so, you know, it just makes sense to me... to approach you
with it. >> COLBY: I'll make you a deal.
It's me, you and Amber through to the end.
>> JERRI: Make me a deal? What is that?!
>> COLBY: Well, you were wanting to strike a deal earlier.
Jerri probably wears a name tag that says "puppet master" on it.
She loves having Amber in her hip pocket, and Mitchell in the
same place. I mean, I simply agreed to go
along with them just because I thought it could get me down the
road a little better. It's all good.
( Jerri laughs ) I want to win, and I don't
want to talk to anybody else about loyalties.
Don't give me that crap. I haven't trusted anyone since
day one, and anyone playing smart should have been the same
way. >> TINA: What about the pigs?
>> COLBY: Nothing. >> JERRI: No luck.
>> COLBY: We didn't even see anything.
I'm going to have to piggyback your ass over this to keep you
dry. >> JERRI: Oh, my gosh. Whoo!
Oh, you're all muscle. >> COLBY: I'm going to need some
rest when I get back. I'm gonna die.
( snoring ) >> NICK: Elisabeth?
>> ELISABETH: Yeah? >> NICK: There's a pig in the
water. >> ELISABETH: What?
>> NICK: There's a pig in the water.
>> ELISABETH: A pig? >> NICK: Yeah.
>> ELISABETH: There is a pig! Right over there.
Oh, God, Mike's gone with the knife.
>> MICHAEL: Why don't you guys come and help me surround him.
You guys, I got him cornered here.
Just keep walking around the way you're walking.
>> NICK: Don't charge me. >> MICHAEL: He won't.
You know, what I want you to do is I want you to block off that
entrance there. >> NICK: All right.
>> MICHAEL: Here he comes. ( pig snorting )
( pig squealing ) ( sighing with relief )
>> NICK: We got a pig. >> ELISABETH: What got it?
>> NICK: He killed it. It was a gross thought, dude.
He had to, he had to... I'm so glad Kimmi wasn't here.
>> ALICIA: Yeah. Where is she? >> ELISABETH: If she was, she
would have died. She would have died.
>> NICK: It was, it was... >> ELISABETH: Brutal.
>> NICK: ...gross. It was very gross and brutal.
>> MICHAEL: Life is just a funny little blending of experiences,
and this is just another one. How it will affect me at my end
of the tribe, I don't know. It could go either way at this
point. But if I go out, I'm going out
full. And I'm so happy about that.
( chuckling ) >> ELISABETH: Oh, my God.
Oh, this is like a murder scene. >> MICHAEL: When I butcher a
deer, I use a hatchet and a knife.
I think I need to cut the skin more on the top now, too.
>> ELISABETH: Oh, my God. Oh, my God. Oh, my God.
Oh, my God. >> ALICIA: Lots of butchering
going on in Kucha camp today. >> JEFF V.: This is nothing like
a chicken, that's for sure. >> ALICIA: We've reached a new
level. >> NICK: This is the craziest
thing I've ever seen in my life. >> MICHAEL: This is how I'm
going to show up at the immunity challenge.
>> RODGER : Pig blood... >> ELISABETH: Did you just put
that on your face? >> RODGER: Yeah, he did.
>> MICHAEL: Just like that. ( Rodger cheering )
>> ELISABETH: You're crazy. >> JEFF V.: Mike caught a pig.
He actually caught a pig. >> KIMMI: I cannot deal with
these people. I cannot... How big of a pig?
>> JEFF V.: It's a little one. And there's going to be a lot of
ham and bacon and pork coming up in here... soon.
>> KIMMI: What is wrong with you people?!
This is sick. We live in a sick tribe.
>> MICHAEL: These are pure, fleshy steaks.
>> ALICIA: The fact that Mike had the guts to go after that
pig says a lot about Mike's character.
I can appreciate the fact that Mike did that, you know?
And-and Mike did that for the tribe.
Mike killed this pig for us so we can all eat.
We're having a barbie. >> RODGER: Mmm... that's
cooked... >> JEFF V.: Oh, my God.
Mmm... >> ALICIA: It's good, right?
>> MICHAEL: I feel better about my position now that I've made
this kill. I think my position in the tribe
has come up a few levels, and... it's a good feeling.
>> ELISABETH: Whoa, we're going to get strong now.
>> COLBY: A little bit of love. "You all read the books and
crammed for the test. So now it's the time for
survivor knows best. Head down to the falls with your
thinking caps on. If you lose the next challenge,
one more will be gone." >> JERRI: First merge with equal
equal amounts of people on both tribes.
We can't lose another immunity challenge, so the pressure now
is even more immense than it was before.
But the next two immunities are crucial for us and our survival
at the merge. >> JEFF: Take back the immunity
idol. The immunity idol is now back up
for grabs. So, last reward, you guys must
be eating pretty well. >> JEFF V: We haven't really
been eating the chickens much because yesterday we all went
out on a, uh, pig hunt and we, uh, stalked a pig and, uh, we
put a spear right through its heart and, uh, we've been eating
pig for about a whole day. >> JEFF: Reaction? They caught a
pig. >> COLBY: We'd like to have one,
too. >> JEFF: You've been out looking
for a pig? >> COLBY: Yeah, you bet.
>> JEFF: Well, today's challenge-- certainly more
important than chickens or roosters, even pork.
At the end of this challenge, one tribe will return to camp
safe in the knowledge they're secure for another three days.
The other tribe will head to Tribal Council, and you will
vote another member out of your tribe.
It's a simple question-and- answer game.
There are six spots per tribe. You'll start at the back and
move forward by filling in the spots with correct answers.
Your goal: be the first tribe to get right here on the yellow
spot and you get immunity. All right?
Let's go. Head down, pick the first
person. Michael, Mitchell, come on up.
Multiple choice: it is possible to improvise a compass by
magnetizing a needle which of the following: A) silk; B)
cotton; c) hard wood; or D) running water.
Show me your answers. You both say A) silk.
That's right. Take your first spots.
>> ALICIA: All right! >> TINA: Good job! Good job!
>> JEFF: Elisabeth, Keith, come on forward.
True or false: the number of flies in Australia increased
after the arrival of Europeans? You both say true.
True is correct. Take your next spot.
All right, Alicia, Amber, come on up.
In order to safely purify water, it must be boiled for at least,
A) five minutes; B) ten minutes; C), 15 minutes or; D) 20
minutes? Correct answer: B) ten minutes.
Pick your spot. ( cheering and whooping )
Ogakor has a one-point lead. Next two.
The answer is true. Take a spot. We're even up.
( cheering ) Alicia and Jerri, back of the
line. Colby, going against Jeff.
True. >> Yes!
( cheering ) >> JEFF: Ogakor in the lead.
Kimmi says false, Jerri says true.
False is right. Kimmi, take a spot.
Alicia and Tina. What was that little thing you
just did, Alicia? Is that a little...
>> ALICIA: Just getting ready. >> JEFF: Okay.
>> ALICIA: Third time's a charm, hopefully.
>> JEFF: Of the ten most venomous snakes in the world,
how many live here? A) three; B) six: C) nine... or
D) ten? Both wrong. It's nine.
See you again in a minute. All right, Jeff, Jerri, you both
say true. You're right. Take a spot.
Nick, Tina, you're both right. >> NICK: All right!
>> TINA: Thank you, God! >> JEFF: Take your spots.
( whooping ) Okay, Alicia, come on up.
And Mitchell, you'll be the tie- breaker for Ogakor.
Here's what I'm thinking: I'm thinking, this tie-breaker's a
little tougher on you, Alicia, because Mitchell at least has
already answered one. >> ALICIA: Right.
>> JEFF: He can always fall back on that.
>> ALICIA: That's right. >> JEFF: You haven't answered
squat. You'll be leading the hike to
Tribal Council. >> ALICIA: Thanks for telling
me. Thanks for just reassuring me
like that. >> JEFF: We're in a tie-breaker
situation. If you both get it right, we go
again. First person to miss, their
tribe loses, they go to Tribal Council.
Multiple choice: Which of the following animals have toxic
eggs which should not be touched?
A) gowannas, b) cane toads, c) akidnas or d) bearded dragons?
>> You both said B) cane toads. You're both right.
Going to another question: When building a fire, you should
never use dead wood to start the fire, A);
B) situate your fire near a rock slide; C) place wet rocks near
the fire; or D) use a car battery to start the fire?
For immunity. Mitchell says B) you should
never situate your fire near a rock slide.
Alicia says C) you should never place wet rocks near the fire.
C) is right. Kucha wins.
( wild cheering ) Kucha, you get the immunity idol
back. >> AMBER: We're feeling kind of
blah right now and we're not too excited to make that hike again
tonight. >> JERRI: And so we prepare once
again for the walk of shame. >> MITCHELL: I'll have plenty to
say to the camera when I hold up Keith's name.
He seems to be an instigator, a few problems.
So, when he goes, it'll be a sigh of relief for me.
>> KEITH: Jerri likes to think that she is the leader in some
way because Amber and Mitchell, she kind of leads them around a
little bit. My goal tonight is to try to
step in and break all that up. I'll offer my opinion to the
